Try a new sport with the 'Turn Up and Play' sessions

By Henry Gee

Henry Gee attends a 'Turn Up and Play' Volleyball session for a new, supportive and volunteer lead fitness experience

Volleyball men smashed by high-flying Northumbria

York found themselves on the receiving end of a thrashing today as Northumbria University swept them aside in straight sets.

Dominant netball firsts claim Sunderland victory

York's netball firsts produced a dominant performance, as they thrashed their counterparts from Sunderland 43-16 today.

Hull in seventh heaven as York's hockey men are destroyed

York's depleted hockey firsts were humiliated on their own turf in their Varsity match on Sunday. Despite being two BUCS leagues above the team from Humberside, they found themselves on the end of a drubbing.

Brave netballers fight hard but lose out to Hull

Despite pushing Hull extremely close in the last quarter, York ultimately came away with nothing in a pulsating encounter.

Dominant women's basketballers claim all three points in Varsity clash

The women's basketball firsts produced a dominating display to dispatch their counterparts from Hull 72-28.

York and Hull draw in Varsity but the real winner is Mixed Martial Arts

In a packed L/N/028, York and Hull met in what can only be described as a brutal evening of Mixed Martial Arts.

York seal Varsity football win, but referee ruins spectacle

York firsts comfortably defeated Hull firsts in the Varsity football match with a brace from Tom Clarke and one from Tom Brandreth proving to be the difference.

Men's basketballers claim shock Varsity victory

Quick-paced and sharp, York's men's basketball team triumphed over Hull by a 20 point margin, winning 67-47 in Sunday's Varsity clash.

Men's lacrosse take Varsity points

The men's lacrosse team put on a cohesive and fiery display this Sunday at Varsity, winning 5-2 against a Hull team previously undefeated this season.

Centurions lose out in Varsity clash

A spirited first half display by York Centurions gave way to a second half collapse, with their Hull counterparts running out eventual 33-6 victors in their American football Varsity matchup.

Boxing is big news again, though not for the right reasons

Christopher Grimes examines the state of boxing in the aftermath of Derek Chisora and David Haye's press conference brawl in Munich. (Thumbnail credit WBC Heavyweight Champion Vitali Klitschko, Image: TheDailySportsHerald via flickr Creative Commons)

York secure narrow trampolining victory

York gained three points for Varsity after a close contest in the trampolining. Although Hull won the novice category, wins in the intermediate and advanced classes helped York achieve victory.

Hull take the spoils in men's rugby

York's men's rugby firsts were on the end of a heavy defeat in their Varsity clash with Hull.

York fencers foil Hull to take Varsity points

York's fencers recorded a comprehensive victory against their Varsity rivals, winning in all three weapons classes to take maximum points for the home side. (Thumbnail credit Image: Philippa Grafton)

Double Varsity joy for York's badminton firsts

York's badminton teams thrashed Hull, gaining six points for the home team in Varsity. The women's badminton team recorded an 8-0 whitewash against their opponents while the men's team won 6-2.

Netball seconds demolish Hull

In an eagerly anticipated match-up, it was York who came away with the glory in a highly-charged tie, outclassing Hull 52-16.

Tennis firsts demolish Hull counterparts

On a day when York comfortably retained the Varsity crown, both the men's and women's tennis lived up to the rest of the sports teams' achievements by destroying Hull over on the surprisingly well-attended tennis courts.

As it happened: White Rose Varsity 2012

Live coverage from the Nouse Sport team of White Rose Varsity 2012. Scores, commentary, & match reports

James maintain impressive form with victory over Alcuin

In the unfamiliar territory of a Saturday fixture, James overcame a late rally from Alcuin to win comfortably by four goals to two.

Impressive Halifax come from behind to defeat Langwith

Halifax proved too strong for Langwith and the extra quality in their squad shone through, as they came from behind to eventually claim an impressive 4-1 victory and back-to-back wins.

Late strike rescues a point for Vanbrugh

Phil Taylor scored a late equaliser to give Vanbrugh a deserved point against Derwent in Saturday's re-arranged college football.

Green goal gives Wentworth victory over Goodrcike

Dom Green's second-half goal proved to be the winner, as Wentworth ran out narrow winners over Goodricke in Saturday's college football.

Golfers hand York early Varsity lead

York's golfers produced a superb performance on Friday to put three points on the board for the home team in this week's White Rose Varsity competition against Hull.

White Rose Varsity can have real value

This Sunday sees the return of Varsity, as our rivals from Hull travel up here for the second time after replacing York St John last year.

White Rose Varsity returns, with York looking to retain their crown

The second White Rose Varsity between York and Hull takes place this Sunday, with the one day event sure to be extremely competitive.

York's Harrison claims UK University Darts title

York student Alex 'The Arm' Harrison was crowned UK University Darts Singles champion on Saturday, in a tournament held in James College's Roger Kirk Centre. (Thumbnail credit Image: Dan Holland)

Netballers set for Superleague warm-up action

York's netball firsts team will team up with rivals Hull heading into Varsity weekend, as they take on a combined Leeds and Leeds Met side in a warm-up game for the Netball Superleague clash between Yorkshire Jets and Loughborough Lightning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Agatha Torrance)

Futsal firsts seize title in dramatic finale

Against the odds, York firsts emerged as league champions in a fairy-tale finish to the futsal season.

York slump to Hull defeat after second half collapse

The men's rugby firsts produced a dismal second half display as they slumped to defeat against Hull today.

Agonising Cup exit for women's basketballers

The women's basketball firsts suffered an agonising defeat today in the Quarter Finals of the BUCS Cup, as they went down 47-51 to Northumbria.
